reviews.text:
I am really impressed by the professionalism and help rendered by the resident monk for the House blessing ceremony and willingness to go extra mile despite his busy schedule of also supervising the exam on same day. So far... the support and experience has been great, no words can describe the experience and the great help rendered by Buddhist library.
Also many thanks for the great support and coordination by Mary. Without her great help, I guess I am still stuck...

In addition to the library of books, they have a weekly Sunday  morning service with chanting, meditation, and Dhamma talk.  There are many other activities too to deepen one’s understanding and practice of Buddhism.

My favourite library in Singapore. There is a membership fee if you want to borrow books, but it’s worth it. Alice the librarian is also very kind. Suttas, commentaries and biographies from each of the traditions - Theravada Buddhism (the way of the Elders); Mahayana Buddhism (which speaks the language of its audience); and Tibetan Buddhism (which gets a bit esoteric) - can be found here. There are also books on quantum physics because Buddhism is about seeing the true nature of things.
Also known as Buddhist library. It hosts a wide collection of Buddhist books. 2nd floor has a large meditation room for hosting events and Tuesday meditation classes
Great place for borrowing books on Buddhism. There are also many classes on Buddhism, Pali and meditation.
